required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the current study is to investigate the safety and efficacy of a single dose of intranasal (IN) ketamine in treatment-resistant depression (TRD).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Number of patients meeting response criteria of >=50% decrease in MADRS score from baseline , ie, difference in depressive symptoms using MADRS instrument, 24 hours following drug administration 10-item instrument used for the evaluation of depressive symptoms in adults and for the assessment of any changes to those symptoms. Each of the 10 items is rated on a scale of 0 to 6, with differing descriptors for each item. These individual item scores are added together to form a total score, which can range between 0 and 60 points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Systematic Assessment for Treatment Emergent Effects (SAFTEE)
secondary_outcome.description: This is a self-report measure for systematically assessing 48 possible adverse events. It documents their severity, relationship to study drug, and the action taken.

arm_group.description: Subjects randomized to this arm will receive the active study medication, intranasal ketamine.
Subjects randomized to this arm will receive intranasal saline.

intervention.description: A single dose of intranasal ketamine up to 50 mg

overall_official.affiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

facility.name: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

link.description: Mount Sinai School of Medicine Mood and Anxiety Disorders Program

results_reference.citation: Lapidus KA, Levitch CF, Perez AM, Brallier JW, Parides MK, Soleimani L, Feder A, Iosifescu DV, Charney DS, Murrough JW. A randomized controlled trial of intranasal ketamine in major depressive disorder. Biol Psychiatry. 2014 Dec 15;76(12):970-6. doi: 10.1016/j.biopsych.2014.03.026. Epub 2014 Apr 3.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study participants were recruited from physician referrals, media advertisements, and an academic outpatient psychiatric clinic. All study treatments were performed at Mount Sinai Medical Center between April 2012 and June 2013.

group.title: Ketamine Then Placebo
group.description: Ketamine: A single dose of intranasal ketamine up to 50 mg for 7 days in first intervention. Then Placebo for 7 days in 2nd intervention.

group.title: Placebo, Then Ketamine
group.description: placebo: Single dose of saline (0.9% saline solution) intranasal for 7 days in first intervention, then Ketamine 50mg in second intervention.

baseline.population: one participant data information missing for history of Psychotherapy, and history of Failed Antidepressant Medications.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Length of Current Episode in Years
Failed Antidepressants Medications
measure.description: n=19 missing information for one participant

measure.title: History of Psychotherapy
measure.description: n=19 missing information for one participant

measure.title: Baseline Inventory of Depressive Symptoms- Clinician Rated (Screen)
measure.description: Inventory of Depressive Symptoms - Clinician Rated (IDS-C) has 30 items. Each item is rated 0-3, total score rage from 0 to 90, from mild to severe.

outcome.title: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)
outcome.description: Number of patients meeting response criteria of >=50% decrease in MADRS score from baseline , ie, difference in depressive symptoms using MADRS instrument, 24 hours following drug administration 10-item instrument used for the evaluation of depressive symptoms in adults and for the assessment of any changes to those symptoms. Each of the 10 items is rated on a scale of 0 to 6, with differing descriptors for each item. These individual item scores are added together to form a total score, which can range between 0 and 60 points.
outcome.population: 20 patients randomized and 18 completed both treatment periods

group.title: Ketamine
group.description: Ketamine: A single dose of intranasal ketamine up to 50 mg

group.title: Placebo
group.description: placebo: Single dose of saline intranasal

measure.title: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)
measure.description: Number of patients meeting response criteria of >=50% decrease in MADRS score from baseline , ie, difference in depressive symptoms using MADRS instrument, 24 hours following drug administration 10-item instrument used for the evaluation of depressive symptoms in adults and for the assessment of any changes to those symptoms. Each of the 10 items is rated on a scale of 0 to 6, with differing descriptors for each item. These individual item scores are added together to form a total score, which can range between 0 and 60 points.
measure.population: 20 patients randomized and 18 completed both treatment periods

outcome.title: Systematic Assessment for Treatment Emergent Effects (SAFTEE)
outcome.description: This is a self-report measure for systematically assessing 48 possible adverse events. It documents their severity, relationship to study drug, and the action taken.
outcome.population: Number of events, more detailed in adverse event section

measure.title: Systematic Assessment for Treatment Emergent Effects (SAFTEE)

reported_events.desc: No serious adverse events occurred during the study.

event.sub_title: Ringing in ears or trouble hearing

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Small sample size. Ongoing treatment with psychotropic medication allowed at stable doses makes it difficult to distinguish an intrinsic effect of ketamine from benefits resulting from the combination of ketamine with other antidepressant agents.

point_of_contact.organization: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
